alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Franklin (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 9:45PM EDT until July 09 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL CLINTON AND EAST CENTRAL FRANKLIN COUNTIES... At 945 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and Emergency Management reports IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Schuyler Falls, Saranac, Mooers, Altona, Jericho, Dannemora, Peasleeville, Clayburg, Lyon Mountain, Champlain, Cadyville, Alder Bend, Miner Lake State Park, West Plattsburgh, Moffitsville, West Beekmantown, Moffittsville, Chazy Lake, Irona and Morrisonville. Reports of road closures have been received, including in the towns of Altona and Saranac. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
